paper_title.en: Relation between hydrogen storage properties and structure of Nd-Co-B amorphous alloys

description.en: Hydrogen storage properties of NdxCo85-xB15 (x=5-30) amorphous alloys produced by melt-spinning, such as hydrogen absorbing rates, storage capacities and desorption spectra, have been measured and compared with their structural features such as radial distribution functions and coordination numbers obtained by X-ray diffraction analyses. The storage capacity under 1 MPa H-2 at 423 K increases nearly quadratically with Nd concentration as H/M congruent to 0.001x(2) (M=Nd+Co+B). The absorbed hydrogen is desorbed upon heating in stages around 350-600 K and at higher temperatures. The first stage is desorption from the amorphous phase, and most of the hydrogen is desorbed at this stage in the alloys with x less than or equal to 20. Hydrogen atoms are accommodated in tetrahedral sites of Nd2Co2 and Nd3Co1 configurations separated from trigonal prisms composed of Co and B atoms, and extend the Nd-Nd pair distance by 9% and Nd-Co by less than 3% but not influencing the Co-Co distance at all. The coordination numbers about Nd and Co atoms are preserved before and after hydrogenation, indicating that the medium- as well as long-range atomic distribution is not modified by hydrogen absorption in these amorphous alloys.

paper_title.en: Relation between hydrogen storage properties and structure of Nd-Co-B amorphous alloys

description.en: Hydrogen storage properties of NdxCo85-xB15 (x=5-30) amorphous alloys produced by melt-spinning, such as hydrogen absorbing rates, storage capacities and desorption spectra, have been measured and compared with their structural features such as radial distribution functions and coordination numbers obtained by X-ray diffraction analyses. The storage capacity under 1 MPa H-2 at 423 K increases nearly quadratically with Nd concentration as H/M congruent to 0.001x(2) (M=Nd+Co+B). The absorbed hydrogen is desorbed upon heating in stages around 350-600 K and at higher temperatures. The first stage is desorption from the amorphous phase, and most of the hydrogen is desorbed at this stage in the alloys with x less than or equal to 20. Hydrogen atoms are accommodated in tetrahedral sites of Nd2Co2 and Nd3Co1 configurations separated from trigonal prisms composed of Co and B atoms, and extend the Nd-Nd pair distance by 9% and Nd-Co by less than 3% but not influencing the Co-Co distance at all. The coordination numbers about Nd and Co atoms are preserved before and after hydrogenation, indicating that the medium- as well as long-range atomic distribution is not modified by hydrogen absorption in these amorphous alloys.

paper_title.en: Electronic structure and electrical conductivity of amorphous Ni-Si alloy films

description.en: The NixSi100-x system forms a homogeneous amorphous phase over wide ranges of composition (0 less than or equal to x less than or equal to 34 and 63 less than or equal to x less than or equal to 73) when the alloy is deposited on a substrate by sputtering at ambient temperature. The electrical conductivity of the amorphous alloy changes characteristically with Ni concentration from a semiconductor-like temperature dependence to a metallic one: the transition taking place between 10.4 and 16.6% Ni. UPS valence band spectra show that the density of states at the Fermi level is minimal below about 7% Ni, but emerges abruptly above this concentration. The relationship between the electrical transport properties and the electronic structure of the amorphous alloys is discussed in three characteristic regions of the Ni concentration.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN

paper_title.en: Electronic structure and metal-insulator transition in amorphous Pd-Si alloy films

description.en: The PdxSi100-x system forms a homogeneous amorphous phase over a wide range of composition (0 less than or equal to x less than or equal to 91, excluding regions near PdSi and Pd2Si) when the alloy is deposited on a substrate by sputtering at ambient temperature. The electrical conductivity of the amorphous alloy changes characteristically with Pd concentration from a semiconductor to a metal, the transition taking place at x(c) approximate to 12. UPS valence band spectra show that the density of states at the Fermi level is minimal for x < x(c), but emerges abruptly for x greater than or equal to x(c). AES SiL(2,3) VV spectra show that covalent Si-Si bonding is gradually reduced and replaced by metallic Pd-Si bonding as the concentration increases beyond the transition region. Relationships between the conducting properties and electronic structure of the amorphous alloys are discussed in three characteristic ranges of Pd concentration.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN

paper_title.en: Electronic structure and metal-insulator transition in amorphous Pd-Si alloy films

description.en: The PdxSi100-x system forms a homogeneous amorphous phase over a wide range of composition (0 less than or equal to x less than or equal to 91, excluding regions near PdSi and Pd2Si) when the alloy is deposited on a substrate by sputtering at ambient temperature. The electrical conductivity of the amorphous alloy changes characteristically with Pd concentration from a semiconductor to a metal, the transition taking place at x(c) approximate to 12. UPS valence band spectra show that the density of states at the Fermi level is minimal for x < x(c), but emerges abruptly for x greater than or equal to x(c). AES SiL(2,3) VV spectra show that covalent Si-Si bonding is gradually reduced and replaced by metallic Pd-Si bonding as the concentration increases beyond the transition region. Relationships between the conducting properties and electronic structure of the amorphous alloys are discussed in three characteristic ranges of Pd concentration.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN

paper_title.en: STRUCTURE AND THERMAL-STABILITY OF ND-NI-B AMORPHOUS-ALLOYS

description.en: The glass-forming range, crystallization behaviour and atomistic structures of Nd-Ni-B amorphous alloys have been studied. In the Ni-rich region (greater than or equal to 40 at. % Ni), a single amorphous phase can be produced by melt-spinning when the neodymium content is less than the boron content. The crystallization temperatures show definite maxima against neodymium content at similar to 10 at. % Nd regardless of the nickel or boron content. By analyzing the radial distribution functions G(r)'s obtained by X-ray diffraction, partial pair correlations have been identified and pair distances determined. The Nd-Ni-B amorphous alloys, like the Nd-Fe-B system, appear to have a trigonal prism as a structural unit.

paper_title.en: STRUCTURE AND THERMAL-STABILITY OF ND-NI-B AMORPHOUS-ALLOYS

description.en: The glass-forming range, crystallization behaviour and atomistic structures of Nd-Ni-B amorphous alloys have been studied. In the Ni-rich region (greater than or equal to 40 at. % Ni), a single amorphous phase can be produced by melt-spinning when the neodymium content is less than the boron content. The crystallization temperatures show definite maxima against neodymium content at similar to 10 at. % Nd regardless of the nickel or boron content. By analyzing the radial distribution functions G(r)'s obtained by X-ray diffraction, partial pair correlations have been identified and pair distances determined. The Nd-Ni-B amorphous alloys, like the Nd-Fe-B system, appear to have a trigonal prism as a structural unit.

paper_title.en: STRUCTURE AND CRYSTALLIZATION OF CU50TI50-XALX AMORPHOUS-ALLOYS

description.en: In the Cu50Ti50-xAlx system, amorphous alloys are obtained by melt-quenching technique in the range 0 less-than-or-equal-to x less-than-or-equal-to 40. The structure of these glasses is investigated by X-ray radial distribution function (RDF) analysis, and the crystallization behavior is studied by differential scanning calorimetry and X-ray diffraction. A Cu-Cu pair correlation is resolved in the differential reduced RDF, DELTAG(r), which has been obtained by subtracting G(r) for binary Cu50Ti50 from those for ternary alloy glasses. The radial distances for the correlation peaks are consistent with those for a dense random packing. In the vicinity of Cu50Ti25Al25 (20 less-than-or-equal-to x less-than-or-equal-to 30), an additional Cu-Cu correlation is found at distances corresponding to the first and third neighbors of the crystalline compound Cu2TiAl (Heusler phase). This indicates that a short-range order structure similar to this compound is developed in these glassy alloys. The crystallization temperature determined by DSC is strongly reduced in the above range of x, where the single Heusler phase is found to crystallize preferentially. An anomaly is also observed in the photoemission valence band spectra for the glassy alloys in this range of composition.

paper_title.ja: Photoemission study of electronic structures of Nd-Fe and Nd-Fe-B alloy glasses

paper_title.en: X-RAY-DIFFRACTION STUDY ON THE STRUCTURE OF LA-NI-MG ALLOY GLASSES AND THEIR HYDRIDES

description.en: X-ray structure analyses of La-Ni-Mg alloy glasses have been performed over a wide range of composition and effects of hydrogenation on the structure have been examined. From the reduced radial distribution function G(r) and its difference function DELTAG(r), interatomic distances of partial pair correlations have been obtained. Hydrogen charging increases the La-La and La-Ni distances and strengthens the Ni-Ni correlation.

publication_name.en: ZEITSCHRIFT FUR PHYSIKALISCHE CHEMIE-INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL OF RESEARCH IN PHYSICAL CHEMISTRY & CHEMICAL PHYSICS

paper_title.en: STRUCTURE AND CRYSTALLIZATION OF CU50TI50-XALX AMORPHOUS-ALLOYS

description.en: In the Cu50Ti50-xAlx system, amorphous alloys are obtained by melt-quenching technique in the range 0 less-than-or-equal-to x less-than-or-equal-to 40. The structure of these glasses is investigated by X-ray radial distribution function (RDF) analysis, and the crystallization behavior is studied by differential scanning calorimetry and X-ray diffraction. A Cu-Cu pair correlation is resolved in the differential reduced RDF, DELTAG(r), which has been obtained by subtracting G(r) for binary Cu50Ti50 from those for ternary alloy glasses. The radial distances for the correlation peaks are consistent with those for a dense random packing. In the vicinity of Cu50Ti25Al25 (20 less-than-or-equal-to x less-than-or-equal-to 30), an additional Cu-Cu correlation is found at distances corresponding to the first and third neighbors of the crystalline compound Cu2TiAl (Heusler phase). This indicates that a short-range order structure similar to this compound is developed in these glassy alloys. The crystallization temperature determined by DSC is strongly reduced in the above range of x, where the single Heusler phase is found to crystallize preferentially. An anomaly is also observed in the photoemission valence band spectra for the glassy alloys in this range of composition.

paper_title.en: X-RAY-DIFFRACTION STUDY OF LOCAL ATOMIC STRUCTURES IN AMORPHOUS ND-FE-B ALLOYS

description.en: Local atomic structures in NdxFe82B18-x (x=0 to 18) and NdxFe100-x (x= 15 to 25) alloy glasses prepared by melt spinning are studied with X-ray diffraction technique. The total radial distribution function G(r) of each alloy is decomposed into partials, G(Fe-Fe)(r) and G(Fe-Nd)(r), and near-neighbour distances and coordination numbers associated with the Fe-Fe and Fe-Nd correlations are determined. The structure of the ternary alloy system is characterized by packing of a trigonal prism of 6 Fe atoms with a B atom at the center and 3 outer Nd atoms capping the rectangular faces, as is found in crystalline Nd2Fe14B compound. X-ray photoemission spectra of these alloys indicate that strong chemical bonding is formed between Fe and B atoms. Variation of the spectra with composition is understood on the basis of this local atomic structure.

paper_title.en: X-RAY-DIFFRACTION STUDY OF LOCAL ATOMIC STRUCTURES IN AMORPHOUS ND-FE-B ALLOYS

description.en: Local atomic structures in NdxFe82B18-x (x=0 to 18) and NdxFe100-x (x= 15 to 25) alloy glasses prepared by melt spinning are studied with X-ray diffraction technique. The total radial distribution function G(r) of each alloy is decomposed into partials, G(Fe-Fe)(r) and G(Fe-Nd)(r), and near-neighbour distances and coordination numbers associated with the Fe-Fe and Fe-Nd correlations are determined. The structure of the ternary alloy system is characterized by packing of a trigonal prism of 6 Fe atoms with a B atom at the center and 3 outer Nd atoms capping the rectangular faces, as is found in crystalline Nd2Fe14B compound. X-ray photoemission spectra of these alloys indicate that strong chemical bonding is formed between Fe and B atoms. Variation of the spectra with composition is understood on the basis of this local atomic structure.

paper_title.en: AN EXAFS STUDY OF SHORT-RANGE STRUCTURE OF AMORPHOUS PD-TI ALLOYS

description.en: The atomic-scale structure of amorphus Ti100-xPdx (x=34, 37, 45 and 48) alloy films produced by RF sputtering has been studied using the EXAFS technique. EXAFS spectra at both Pd K-edge and Ti K-edge have been examined. The interatomic spacings between the nearest neighbors, r(Pd-Pd), r(Ti-Ti) and r(Pd-Ti), have been evaluated and compared with those of crystalline films of Pd, Ti and their solid solutions. The magnitudes of these nearest-pair distances are consistent with those evaluated by X-ray diffraction of the same materials. It has been found that r(Pd-Ti) is approximately 10% smaller than the arithmetic mean of r(Pd-Pd) and r(Ti-Ti). This constriction is attributable to covalent bonds formed between Pd and Ti atoms.

paper_title.en: AN EXAFS STUDY OF SHORT-RANGE STRUCTURE OF AMORPHOUS PD-TI ALLOYS

description.en: The atomic-scale structure of amorphus Ti100-xPdx (x=34, 37, 45 and 48) alloy films produced by RF sputtering has been studied using the EXAFS technique. EXAFS spectra at both Pd K-edge and Ti K-edge have been examined. The interatomic spacings between the nearest neighbors, r(Pd-Pd), r(Ti-Ti) and r(Pd-Ti), have been evaluated and compared with those of crystalline films of Pd, Ti and their solid solutions. The magnitudes of these nearest-pair distances are consistent with those evaluated by X-ray diffraction of the same materials. It has been found that r(Pd-Ti) is approximately 10% smaller than the arithmetic mean of r(Pd-Pd) and r(Ti-Ti). This constriction is attributable to covalent bonds formed between Pd and Ti atoms.
